Stu Miley.Action: No direct actions or statements in the excerpt; mostly an observer of Stanley's embarrassing situation.
Is solemn and nervous during the cartoon screening while others laugh, showing sensitivity and self-consciousness about his work.
Appears sardonic and self-deprecating in manner, which may create distance with others.
Remains solemn and nervous during the sneak preview, not laughing with the crowd despite the positive reception.
Nothing in this excerpt indicates Stu Miley taking any competent action or showing skill or intelligence.
Looks genuinely stunned and smiles privately when applauded for his work.
Waves to the adoring crowd in response to their applause.
Jokes about sweatshop workers doing animation instead of himself.
Demurs politely when the fan tries to get him to draw a tattoo on an inappropriate area.
Stands to accept applause for his work as creator, shows modest surprise and gratitude, smiles privately at a supportive gesture, and waves confidently to the crowd.
Admits not doing all the animation himself and jokes about the team handling the work, showing self-awareness and realistic understanding of his role.
Quickly assesses a social situation with a fan wanting him to draw a tattoo guide, thoughtfully considers the task and creatively completes the drawing, earning applause.
Politely declines when fan tries to push boundaries by unbuckling her belt for a larger drawing area, establishing a boundary without embarrassment or awkwardness.
Pulls Julie aside discreetly to show her something important, attempts to create a private moment away from others.
Fails to clearly explain the urgency and significance of what he wants to show Julie, giving up on the explanation.
Waves back to merchandisers but then turns away, showing reluctance to engage with business opportunities.
Expresses feeling overwhelmed and says 'it's all out of hand', indicating a lack of control or confidence in the situation.
Clearly states his personal values and priorities, choosing love and personal happiness over wealth and success.
Decides to propose, showing decisiveness and clarity about his goals in a personal context.
Allows Julie to enter the car first and shows concern about the overwhelming situation, expressing weariness but still trying to manage.
Admits to Julie that he feels weird about the situation and that he doubts his good luck, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Shares a tender moment with Julie, admits she makes him happy, showing trust and affectionate openness.
Negotiates carefully to leave a crowded parking lot full of blocking trucks, backs out cautiously.
Expresses worry and anxiety about the monkey character taking over his life, doubts the good fortune.
Shows emotional vulnerability, admits fear of waking from a dream, but also expresses sincere happiness and optimism.
Checks if Julie is okay after the near accident, showing concern for her well-being.
Opens the car door gingerly and cautiously despite the danger of passing traffic, showing care and prudence.
Despite the sudden obstruction of his windshield by the fallen banner, Stu manages to slam on the brakes and avoid a collision, ultimately stopping his car safely.
Puts himself in danger by opening his car door into oncoming traffic without adequate caution, nearly getting hit.
After nearly being hit by a passing car when opening the door, he wisely waits before attempting again, showing some situational awareness.
Races to check on teenagers after the car crash, showing concern for their well-being.
Expresses worry to Julie about her safety, indicating care and affection.
Races up to the crashed car to check on the occupants, shows concern for others' safety.
Decides to report the accident immediately by going to a phone booth, showing presence of mind.
Fails to notice the unstable telephone pole behind him while focused on calling the operator, putting himself in danger.
Julie holds his hand and expresses love and support while Stu is injured and fading away; Stu seems to accept her presence and comfort.
Silently sinks away from Julie and paramedics, retreating inwardly into limbo without resistance or communication.
Remains conscious and perceptive despite serious injury and ambulance chaos, maintains awareness of surroundings and loved ones.
Passively sinks through the ambulance floor and into limbo without resistance or active effort.
Sits quietly to examine his belongings with some care and discretion, quickly putting away a vinyl LP to avoid embarrassment.
Calls out for help and expresses vulnerability by asking if he's dead.
Screams and runs away when strange creatures approach him, showing fear and avoidance rather than friendliness.
Examines his baggage carefully, looks through personal items thoughtfully.
Calls out for help unsystematically, shows confusion about his situation.
Quickly reacts to strange creatures by screaming and running away.
Runs up the stairs and bolts through the gates to escape pursuers.
Seeks help from humans around but fails to get assistance as they ignore him.
Ditches one of his suitcases while fleeing to lighten his load.
Ducks into the nearest building, avoiding an awkward encounter with admirers.
Flattens himself against the wall to avoid being noticed by dangerous creatures outside.
Ducks into the nearest building to evade recognition and potential trouble from the three-headed devil fans.
Flattens himself against the wall to avoid being seen by roadkill skittering outside the bar.
Responds nervously and with hesitation when confronted by Bull, admitting confusion and fear ('Chasing me - animals - horrible -').
Does not engage in the voice's rude and mocking insults towards Bull, instead physically showing he is not the speaker (claps hands over mouth).
Remains polite and straightforward in answering Bull's questions (name, drink preference), showing basic social politeness and cooperation.
No signs of hostility or aggression towards Bull despite apparent threat and uncomfortable situation.
Acts nervously and tries to avoid confrontation when threatened by Bull and Jumbo.
Has a playful interaction with Monkeybone who kisses him on the nose, causing Stu to scream.
Is about to leave nervously but is intimidated by bull and jumbo, shows no assertiveness or control in the situation.
Backpack bulges and Monkeybone emerges unexpectedly, surprising attackers, but this is more luck or external intervention than Stu's skill.
Sharing playful and goofy moments with Julie, evident in the photo strip showing their silly faces.
Painted disturbing nightmare-themed artwork revealing his struggles but also a form of self-expression and coping.
Joked about curing Julie and engaged in art despite personal torment, showing a mix of humor and vulnerability.
Creates intense, unsettling nightmare paintings during sleep-deprived periods, showing emotional depth and artistic skill.
Switches from right to left hand to rebalance brain hemispheres and produce unique art, indicating adaptability and innovative problem-solving.
Loved enough to have an engagement ring sent to him; inspired care and mourning from close ones.
Shows sympathy by being the only one not laughing at George's humiliation on TV.
Expresses personal pain and frustration openly to Bull about his stalled recovery and situation.
Grimaces at Monkeybone, indicating annoyance or discomfort with his presence.
Shows patience and perseverance by enduring a difficult coma state for three months without giving up on returning home.
Appears disconsolate and unmotivated, expressing frustration and sickness of waiting rather than taking action to improve his situation.
Is affectionately teased by Monkeybone in a humorous dedication showing playful rapport.
Remains passive and grimaces at Monkeybone's disruptive behavior instead of addressing it effectively.
Storms over and yanks Monkeybone off the piano after public humiliation.
Whacks Monkeybone upside the head for inappropriate behavior.
Politely declines interest in local women, citing personal preference respectfully.
Storms over from the bar and decisively yanks Monkeybone off the piano to stop his public humiliation.
Expresses frustration and demands Monkeybone act normally, showing impatience but also a desire to control the situation.
Whacks Monkeybone upside the head after his inappropriate behavior toward women, attempting to maintain order.

Expresses doubt and sadness about never seeing 'her' again, showing vulnerability.
Engages sincerely with Kitty who shows sympathy, indicating openness and appreciation.
Tries to ignore Monkeybone's distracting whisper on his shoulder, showing focus and respect to Kitty's encouragement.
Not obviously responding to Kitty's flirtatious behavior, but not rude or dismissive either.
Has been persistently trying to get through to a powerful figure (the nightmare god) to expedite his case, showing perseverance and goal orientation.
Expresses regret for not having proposed to Kitty, indicating some failure in decisiveness and action in personal matters.
Tries to maintain focus and ignore distractions (Monkeybone's whispering), indicating some control and self-awareness.
Easily distracted by Kitty's cleavage and tail swinging, showing lack of focus and self-discipline.
Blushes bright red and forcibly shoves Monkeybone's tongue back into his mouth after a surprising, intimate gesture.
Responds angrily to Monkeybone's playful behavior by lunging at him and attempting to attack the chandelier.
Shows concern for Kitty by apologizing before chasing Monkeybone under the pool table.
Blushes and manually shoves the monkey's tongue back into its mouth after being shocked.
Lunges at Monkeybone impulsively after being irritated.
Grabs a chair and swings it at the chandelier in an attempt to reach Monkeybone.
Follows Monkeybone under Kitty's dress in pursuit despite the awkward and chaotic situation.
Monkeybone jumps into his arms fearfully; Stu backs away involuntarily with dread.
Stares at Earl Biegler with naked envy upon seeing Earl get a reprieve.
Stares at Earl with naked envy as he receives an E-Ticket reprieve from death.
Expresses frustration at being stuck and questions fairness about not getting an E-ticket to leave.

Acts abruptly by marching up to the Grim Reaper and demanding answers, which could be seen as lacking tact or patience.

Displays frustration and desperation about being stuck down here and never seeing 'her' again.
Hits the Reaper accurately with a baseball, knocking him off his bike and chasing him away.
Expresses frustration and despair, doubting his ability to escape and see his loved one again.
Acts impulsively by throwing baseballs at the Reaper instead of using a more strategic approach.
Shows excitement and hope upon receiving an invitation to Hypnos' pajama party, believing it means an opportunity to go home.
Allows Julie to brush his teeth every morning, indicating trust and tolerance of her care despite her worn appearance and his unconscious state.

Attempts to engage with the five-legged hand woman who smiles at him and pulls him to dance.

Responds to Monkeybone's insult with a quick retort, showing wit and confidence.

Grins in anticipation to watch nightmares with others.
Recognizes himself in a nightmare and shows surprise (face goes pale).
Recognizes himself in the nightmare orb and remains engaged with the unfolding events.
Apologizes immediately when he accidentally sits in the slug-headed man's chair.
Allows the playful chaos around him (e.g., Jumbo breaking arms) without intervening or showing control.
Toasts his beloved Julie, playfully teases her, shares a joyful embrace and laughter.
Looks at the Darktowners with dread and calls out to Julie with concern.
Tries to push forward to the orb despite being blocked and told to chill out.
Desperately calls out to Julie, expressing love and trying to stop others from cutting the cord.
Breaks free from restraints and flings himself on the orb to end the nightmare, showing determination and emotional vulnerability.
Breaks free from restraining guests and pushes through obstacles to reach the nightmare orb despite opposition.
Flings himself onto the orb causing it to short out and abruptly end the nightmare, effectively saving Julie.
Shows intense emotional desperation and calls out repeatedly for Julie, demonstrating determination and presence of mind.
Tries to get a message to his girlfriend despite being dragged around at a chaotic party.
Snatches Monkeybone off the bed to question him, showing concern for the situation.

Snatches Monkeybone off the bed and attempts to control the chaotic situation.
Is unable to prevent being dragged across the dance floor by the Yeti and Jumbo the Elephant God.

Clamps a hand over Monkeybone's mouth to stop him from self-deprecating.
Begging Hypnos to find a way to save Monkeybone, shows concern and urgency.

Clamps a hand over Monkeybone's mouth to stop him from speaking nonsense.

Begging Hypnos to find a solution, showing a willingness to try but also desperation.

Expresses urgency about limited time and willingness to do anything to succeed.

Stops Monkeybone from blurting out a comment at a sensitive moment by covering his mouth.
Reassures Monkeybone by promising protection and encouraging courage.

Yanks on Monkeybone's tail to signal him to shut up during a sensitive moment.

Unable to get the flying bike to fly despite efforts; appears confused or unsuccessful in operating the bike under pressure.

Rides around the periphery of the turntable trying to find a way out when surrounded by enemies.

Laughs and shows relief with Monkeybone after narrowly escaping danger on the flying bike.

Makes a light-hearted, flattering comment to Julie after coming out of coma, eliciting laughter and comforting others.

Engages politely with others, shows surprise and interest in Stephen King, and accepts popcorn offered by him.

Recognizes famous figures and interacts with them, asks questions to understand the situation.

Reacting in disbelief and concern when Hypnos reveals the involvement of his girlfriend and the monkey in the nightmare scheme.

Grins insipidly at Julie and makes a self-centered joke about his own wealth and success.
Observes surroundings quietly and accepts Julie’s welcome and emotional embrace without resistance.

Grins and scoops a fistful of cake with his hands, ignoring social norms and appearing disorganized.

Plays affectionate, playful game with Julie, initiating intimacy and sharing a tender moment.
Flips channels casually and watches a nature special with a somewhat playful and flirtatious attitude.

Almost reacts with shock upon realizing his name's embarrassing origin but hides it well.
Stops kissing Julie to shut the door, silencing the barking dog.
Performs bizarre mating dance that makes Julie nervous and uncomfortable.

Focuses conversation on how to warn and protect his girlfriend from danger.

Engages in a lighthearted moment by repeatedly saying a taboo word and laughing about it, showing playfulness and informal sincerity.
Focuses conversation on media synergy and merchandising, treating people as parts of a 'media machine' and brand extensions, which suggests a more transactional and less personal attitude.

Organizes a press conference and manages media presence effectively.
Demonstrates strategic thinking by linking show, merchandising, religion, and media specials into a synergistic business model.

Willingness to compromise personal dislikes (merchandising) for business success indicates adaptability.
Flings his sweaty handkerchief into the midst of chasing groupies, causing a catfight among them.

Recognizes the potential of the toy despite its crude feature and appreciates it as a work of genius.

Reacts with sincere wonderment and thoughtful enthusiasm rather than simple mockery or dismissal.

Exhibits confidence and dominance by pounding his chest and roaring after the fight.
Works methodically in the garage with equipment and many Monkeybone dolls, indicating preparation and planning.

Recognizes Kitty's trust and help, motivated to escape to help his loved one.

Thanks Kitty and expresses that he will never forget her, despite her disturbing behavior.
Races off to escape danger, leaving Kitty behind as she resumes her feast.
Exhibits mortifying behavior (climbing tree to eliminate and blaming it on dog) which embarrasses others but shows vulnerability and unguarded moments.
Plans a public proposal with excitement and practical details, showing openness and a desire to share a significant moment.
Jokes about marriage protecting him legally, showing a humorous but somewhat cynical side.
Present at suspicious activity near the crime scene (switching Nightmare Juice), but no indication of intervention or concern shown.

Confronts Death with honesty about his actions instead of making excuses, showing sincerity.
Asks Death to give him one last hour to make things right before his soul is taken, indicating responsibility and care.
Responds with good humor to DEATH's compliment about his comic strip.
Offers polite acknowledgement ('Oh. Yeah. Thanks.') to the doctors noticing his injury despite obvious distress.
Responds to Death's kick with minimal reaction but immediately adapts to his new situation occupying the organ donor's body and races around the hospital to solve his problem.

Runs frantically through his house looking for others, showing concern.

Tries to pull himself together despite a severe, gaping wound.

Flies past overhead causing his intestinal loop to knock over glasses and yank the punchbowl off the table, drenching bystanders and causing chaos.
Uses quick thinking and resourcefulness to lasso a water buffalo and stabilize the balloon, trying to manage the dangerous situation.

Appears unsure and relies on Death to decide his fate, suggesting limited personal control or confidence.
Expresses gratitude to Death and receives a powerful send-off.
Reunites with Julie and kisses her long and hard, quelling all doubts about his identity.
Makes a humorous remark about his itchy tail, shrugging it off when Julie smiles.
Returns to his own body and reassures Julie with confidence and charm, kissing her to quell her doubts.
Makes a slip of the tongue ('My tail itches'), but quickly accepts it and shrugs it off without losing composure.

Stu-Bone.Action: Encourages partygoers at the benefit and offers to pay for the next turn.
Blindfolds and embraces a gorgeous woman from behind to help her hit the piñata.
Freezes and backs away terrified when cops arrive, causing an accident.
